alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Robertson; Rutherford; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:43PM CDT until July 18 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR DAVIDSON...NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD...SUMNER...NORTHEASTERN WILLIAMSON...WILSON...SOUTHEASTERN CHEATHAM AND EASTERN ROBERTSON COUNTIES... At 343 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cross Plains to near Nashville to Burns, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Gallatin, Lebanon, Springfield, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill and Coopertown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 191 and 243. Interstate 65 between mile markers 66 and 121. Interstate 24 between mile markers 31 and 65. Interstate 840 between mile markers 64 and 76. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
